rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

Choose which way this card faces before you play it. This ↓ player's Pokémon can't be Asleep or Paralyzed. (If those Pokémon are already Asleep or Paralyzed, remove those Special Conditions.)
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Discard a card from your hand. If you can't discard a card from your hand, you can't play this card.
Search your deck for a Metal Energy card or a Basic Pokémon (or Evolution card) that has δ on its card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Card-Flip Game
rules: Choose 1 of your opponent's face-down Prizes. Guess whether it is an Energy card, a Trainer card, or a Pokémon (Basic or Evolution) card. Flip the card face up (and leave it face up). If you guessed right, draw 2 cards.

rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Root Fossil
rules: Play Root Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Root Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Root Fossil has no attacks of its own, can't retreat, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Root Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Root Fossil from play.

abilities.name: Spongy Stone
abilities.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Root Fossil.

data.name: Pokédex

data.name: Gold Berry
rules: Attach Gold Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

At any time between turns, if there are at least 4 damage counters on the Pokémon Gold Berry is attached to, you may remove 4 of them and discard Gold Berry. At the start of each turn, if there are at least 4 damage counters on the Pokémon Gold Berry is attached to, remove 4 of them and discard Gold Berry.

attacks.name: Heavy Slam
attacks.text: This attack does 30 less damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: Mud that hardens around a Mudsdale's legs sets harder than stone. It's so hard that it allows this Pokémon to scrap a truck with a single kick.

data.name: Blacephalon

attacks.name: Fireworks Bomb
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. If your opponent has exactly 3 Prize cards remaining, put 12 damage counters on them instead.

data.flavorText: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

data.name: Shiinotic

attacks.name: Strength Sap
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.

data.name: Rattata

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It searches for food all day. It gnaws on hard objects to wear down its fangs, which grow constantly during its lifetime.

data.name: Bisharp

attacks.name: Single Lunge
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.

data.name: Alakazam E4 LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Alakazam E4. Alakazam E4 LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Damage Switch
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon SP to another of your Pokémon SP. This power can't be used if Alakazam E4 is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Jolteon

attacks.name: Electrigun
attacks.text: You may discard a Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.

data.name: Barboach
data.flavorText: Its slimy body is hard to grasp. In one region, it is said to have been born from hardened mud.

data.name: Stunky

attacks.name: Severe Gas
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

data.name: Taillow

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.

data.name: Shiftry ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dark Eyes
abilities.text: After your opponent's Pokémon uses a Poké-Power, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Target Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. If that Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Garchomp

attacks.name: Quick Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Royal Blades
attacks.text: If you played Cynthia from your hand during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.flavorText: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.

data.name: Sliggoo

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon's mucous can dissolve anything. Toothless, it sprays mucous on its prey. Once they're nicely dissolved, it slurps them up.

data.name: Regice ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Iceberg Crush
attacks.text: If Regirock ex is in play, flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Hydreigon

abilities.name: Dark Aura
abilities.text: All Energy attached to this Pokémon are Darkness Energy instead of their usual type.

attacks.name: Berserker Blade
attacks.text: Does 40 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

data.name: Great Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Hippowdon

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Stones can get stuck in the ports on their bodies. Dwebble help dislodge such stones, so Hippowdon look after these Pokémon.

data.name: Hariyama ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Commanding Aura
abilities.text: As long as Hariyama ex is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Pivot Throw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Hariyama ex by attacks is increased by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Dome Fossil Kabuto
rules: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Kabuto you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Jigglypuff.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Lucky Stadium
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Once during each player's turn (before attacking), that player may flip a coin. If heads, that player draws a card.

data.name: Turtwig

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy TURTWIG, the shell should feel moist.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Whismur

attacks.name: Uproar
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs.  If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.

data.name: Winona
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Colorless Pokémon and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Stantler

attacks.name: Mystifying Horns
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Big Charge
attacks.text: If you have any Mega Evolution Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: The curved antlers subtly change the flow of air to create a strange space where reality is distorted.

data.name: Enhanced Hammer
rules: Discard a Special Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Super Scoop Up
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Growth Spurt
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to Exeggcute.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Ho-Oh LEGEND
rules: Put this card from your hand onto your Bench only with the other half of Ho-Oh LEGEND.

abilities.name: Sacred Rainbow
abilities.text: All Energy attached to Ho-Oh LEGEND are Fire Energy instead of their usual type.

attacks.name: Bright Wing
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Ho-Oh LEGEND.

data.flavorText: Legends claim this Pokémon flies the world's skies continuously on its magnificent, seven-colored wings.

data.name: Ho-Oh

attacks.name: Scorching Wing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Fire Energy attached to Ho-Oh.

data.flavorText: Legends claim this Pokémon flies the world's skies continuously on its magnificent seven-colored wings.

data.name: Tentacool

abilities.name: Cowardice
abilities.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may return Tentacool to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to Tentacool.) This power can't be used the turn you put Tentacool into play or if Tentacool is affected by a Special Condition.

data.flavorText: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

data.name: Hitmontop

attacks.name: Triple Kick
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Gut Spin
attacks.text: If Tyrogue is anywhere under Hitmontop, you may switch Hitmontop with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It fights while spinning like a top. The centrifugal force boosts its destructive power by ten.

data.name: Pokémon Communication
rules: Reveal a Pokémon in your hand and put it on top of your deck. If you do, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Celesteela

attacks.name: Moon Raker
attacks.text: If the total of both players' remaining Prize cards is exactly 6, this attack can be used for Metal.

data.flavorText: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.

data.name: Gengar Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Gengar-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Assault Boom
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: It throws bones at Mandibuzz to knock it down. It's thought that Marowak is trying to avenge its parent.

data.name: Claydol ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Type Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Claydol ex's type is Fighting until the end of your turn.

attacks.name: Psychic Boom
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Crush
attacks.text: You may discard a Psychic Energy card attached to Claydol ex. If you do, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Ghetsis
rules: Your opponent reveals his or her hand and shuffles all Item cards found there into his or her deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of Item cards your opponent shuffled into his or her deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: White Kyurem-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: White Inferno
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Rocket's Hitmonchan ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Strikes Back
abilities.text: If Rocket's Hitmonchan ex is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Rocket's Hitmonchan ex is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mach Punch
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: M Gardevoir-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brilliant Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Fairy Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Baltoy
data.flavorText: It moves while spinning around on its single foot. Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on their heads.

data.name: Erika's Maids
rules: Trade 2 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and/or Evolution cards with Erika in their names from your deck. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND
rules: Put this card from your hand onto your Bench only with the other half of Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND.
When this Pokémon has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Lost Crisis
attacks.text: Choose 2 Energy attached to Darkrai & Cresselia LEGEND and put them in the Lost Zone. If any of your opponent's Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from this attack, put that Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone instead of discarding it.

attacks.name: Moon's Invite
attacks.text: Move as many damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon as you like to any of your opponent's other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Groudon ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Mark of Antiquity
abilities.text: As long as Groudon ex is your Active Pokémon, each player's Kyogre ex and Rayquaza ex can't attack.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Crushing Mantle
attacks.text: You may discard from your hand as many Energy cards as you like. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card you discarded.

data.name: Aerodactyl ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Primal Lock
abilities.text: As long as Aerodactyl ex is in play, your opponent can't play Pokémon Tool cards. Remove any Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Pokémon and put them into his or her discard pile.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Ninja Boy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and switch it with that Pokémon. (Any attached cards, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle the first Pokémon into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Giant Wave
attacks.text: Wartortle can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Eevee

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: When you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon that is the same type as that Energy card and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Quick Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

data.flavorText: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.

data.name: Floatzel GL LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Floatzel GL. Floatzel GL LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Water Rescue
abilities.text: Whenever any of your Water Pokémon (excluding any Floatzel GL) is Knocked Out by damage from your opponent's attack, you may put that Pokémon and all cards that were attached to it from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Energy Cyclone
attacks.text: Choose as many Energy cards from your hand as you like and show them to your opponent. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards you chose. Put those Energy cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Erika's Perfume
rules: Look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Basic Pokémon cards there, you may put any number of them onto your opponent's Bench (as long as there's room).

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Circle Circuit
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Pokémon on your Bench.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The plan for today is to do nothing. My awesome tail is all curled up, and my ears are tired, too.

data.name: Horsea

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Reverse Thrust
attacks.text: Switch Horsea with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

data.name: Kingdra

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It stores energy by sleeping at underwater depths at which no other life forms can survive.

data.name: Espeon

abilities.name: Solar Revelation
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to each of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Psy Report
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

data.flavorText: Its fur is so sensitive, it can sense minute shifts in the air and predict the weather.

data.name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Snubbull

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Small Pokémon flee from its scary face. It is, however, considered by women to be cute.

data.name: Regirock ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mend
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fighting Energy card and attach it to Regirock ex. If you do, remove 1 damage counter from Regirock ex.

attacks.name: Metal Crush
attacks.text: If Registeel ex is in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Cyclone Energy
rules: Cyclone Energy provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to your Active Pokémon, switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Benched Pokémon to switch.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Let's Eat Together
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from both Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.

data.name: Master Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards from your deck. Choose a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from those cards, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Put the other 6 cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Flygon ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Psychic Protector
abilities.text: If Flygon ex is damaged by an opponent's attack, you may discard up to 4 cards from your hand. If you do, any damage done to Flygon ex is reduced by 10 for each card you discarded.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Flygon ex can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

data.name: Gyarados ★ δ
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Spiral Growth
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Gyarados Star.

attacks.name: All-out Blast
attacks.text: Discard cards from the top of your deck until you have 1 card left. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

data.name: Double Dragon Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Dragon Pokémon. This card provides every type of Energy, but provides only 2 Energy at a time, only while this card is attached to a Dragon Pokémon.
(If this card is attached to anything other than a Dragon Pokémon, discard this card.)

data.name: Shadow Triad
rules: Put a Team Plasma card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rocket's Mewtwo ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Darkness Switch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Rocket's Mewtwo ex, and then switch all damage counters on Rocket's Mewtwo ex with those on the Defending Pokémon. (If an effect of this attack is prevented, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Toxapex
data.flavorText: To attack, this Pokémon sends toxic spikes flying at its enemies. Ones that come close get mown down by the claws on its feet.
